intro: Chamaefilix cristata, commonly known as the rosebay willowherb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine, silky hairs. Native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. This plant is often found along roadsides, waste areas, and in meadows, where it spreads through both seeds and rhizomes.
